snippet: Sharp increases in federal flood insurance rates are starting to hurt property values and housing sales in areas just beginning to recover from the recession, according to residents and legislators.
abstract: Sharp increases in federal flood insurance rates are distressing coastal homeowners from Hawaii to New England and are starting to hurt property values and housing sales in areas just beginning to recover from recession.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, and Campbell Robertson from New Orleans.

lead_paragraph: Sharp increases in federal flood insurance rates are starting to hurt property values and housing sales in areas just beginning to recover from the recession, according to residents and legislators.

headline.main: Cost of Flood Insurance Rises, Along With Worries
headline.print_headline: Cost of Flood Insurance Rises, Along With Worries
